skill.name: Armoury
skill.description: Making armour such as chain mail or ring mail, but also includes leather armour as well.

skill.name: Beekeeping
skill.description: The keeping of bees, and the harvesting of honey from them.

skill.name: Blacksmithing
skill.description: Metal working, including needles, horseshoes, tools and so on. It can be used to make knives and daggers, but anything larger requires the weaponsmithing skill.

skill.name: Bowyer
skill.description: The making of bows and arrows.

skill.name: Brewing
skill.description: Brewing beer and ale. This skill is generally the domain of the ale wives in small villages.

skill.name: Candlemaking
skill.description: The making of candles.

skill.name: Carpentry
skill.description: Crafting items out of wood, from chairs to houses.

skill.name: Clothier
skill.description: Working with cloth, generally in the making of clothes. Can be used for making leather or padded armour if necessary, though this is not normally the domain of clothiers.

skill.name: Cooking
skill.description: The preparing, preserving and cooking of food. Includes some knowledge of herbs.

skill.name: Copicing
skill.description: The care and management of woodland. All manors will have someone skilled in this, and it is not uncommon for such a person to be a carpenter as well.

skill.name: Dairying
skill.description: The making of cheese and other dairy products. Includes caring for and milking cows.

skill.name: Farming
skill.description: The planting, caring for and harvesting of crops, the care and feeding of animals such as cows, sheep and chickens. The majority of people in rural areas will of course be farmers.

skill.name: Glassworking
skill.description: The making of glassware, though this is a rare, and highly sought after, skill.

skill.name: Handicraft
skill.description: The making of baskets, embroidery and other similar village hand crafts not covered by other professional skills.

skill.name: Jewelcraft
skill.description: The crafting of jewelry and gems. Covers artistic skill, as well as knowledge of the values of such items.

skill.name: Masonry
skill.description: The building of houses, bridges and other constructions out of stone.

skill.name: Milling
skill.description: Running a mill, from the grinding of flour to the baking of the bread.

skill.name: Mining
skill.description: Covers being able to locate new mines, and to construct and work them safely.

skill.name: Ostling
skill.description: The care and training of horses.

skill.name: Potter
skill.description: Pottery.

skill.name: Shipwright
skill.description: Ship building.

skill.name: Tanning
skill.description: Tanning.

skill.name: Thatching
skill.description: Thatching.

skill.name: Weaponsmithing
skill.description: The making of weapons, including spears, daggers, swords and axes. The making of bows and arrows is a different profession, which is covered by bowyer.

skill.name: Weaving
skill.description: A profession which includes weaving and spindling.

description.para: The art of forging documents, signature and seals.
